decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: PL-100 Rev A (existing & proposed ground floor plans, OS map); PL-101 Rev A (existing & proposed first floor plans, & front elevations); PL-102 Rev A (existing & proposed loft floor plans, & rear elevations); PL-103 Rev A (existing & proposed roof & section 2); PL-104 Rev A (existing & proposed side elevation); PL-105 Rev A (existing & proposed side elevation 2); PL-106 Rev A (existing & proposed section 1); PL-108 Rev A (existing & proposed site plan)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D1, D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to occupation of the development, enhanced sound insulation of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value shall be implemented for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, namely, kitchen/living/dining/bathroom above/below/adjoining bedroom of separate dwelling. These mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014 and shall be permanently retained hereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | With regard to demolition and construction management, control measures shall be applied to ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays,
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy T7of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided to the rear garden area of the property, and made available for use in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 and table 3.2 of the London Plan (2021).
| At least two (2) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and retained thereafter
Reason: to encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan(2021) policy T5 and table 10.2

| The residential units hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
description: Change of use of rear of ground floor from shop (Use Class E) to dwelling (Use Class C3) to form a single self-contained flat, with single-storey rear extensions; associated alterations to internal layout and amenity, cycle parking and waste storage spaces.
